comments.text: Very informative video, please keep making more. My POV on this is that every new tech goes through a similar evolution curve and vibe coding is no different. Its not dying, its evolving. Fair that the products today aren't perfect and there are problems around quality (so was with early app and web builders) and pricing (so was with early cloud) but they will mature as they all do (or most of them do). Immature products don’t invalidate the problem or the opportunity or the movement; they signal an inflection point towards better products, experience and value.

Sometimes I feel old ways of coding were best. Referring business requirement docs and complete the development from scratch. If we get stuck then refer stack overflow for finding solution. It was time consuming, but logical building in our mind was consistent.
Bravo on yet another excellent video! I always learn so much from your content. Truly grateful for how you spot real trends and guide us developers in the right direction.

your comparison among models was too good , i was one of the person working google in new product launch for context window kernal optimization , it gives me good feeling now people are upgrading in ai becaise people like you , dont forget to meet ,me if you are coming to google banglore
Itna lengthy mat bana bhai video , 5-7 mins enough
I am a software deveoper with 20 years of experience... Mere liye Chat GPT sufficient hai....

That gym analogy had me 😂 — finally someone said it like it is! Vibe coding was fun till the bill arrived. Loved the way you broke it all down. Subscribed, because this kind of clarity is rare in the AI chaos!

Great video Tanay. Agree on most of the points you made. As an engineer who has been with companies like Amazon, MSFT: I completely agree that the agents (at least now) are far from replacing an experienced programmer. They are great at doing VERY scoped tasks or take care of repetitive stuff. But they quickly hallucinate the moment context/complexity increases.

Until one has invested in learning programming, it quickly becomes impossible to understand the issues in the project and fix them. 

VIBE coding is just like any other social media trend which has gone viral for some time but will eventually die down.

No matter what 
If you want to be gr8 coder 
You have to give 2 yrs of time writing code And building muscle memory WITHOUT any ai and agent then when you are ready the. Use ai agent 
App building is like building a bike 
Ai will give you tyre,engine,handle,silencer, etc... All parts 
But until and unless you as a good coder know where to fit which parts thats when you make a gr8 bike(App)
Ai will only give you parts but you habe to connect it

positive: Very informative video, please keep making more. My POV on this is that every new tech goes through a similar evolution curve and vibe coding is no different. Its not dying, its evolving. Fair that the products today aren't perfect and there are problems around quality (so was with early app and web builders) and pricing (so was with early cloud) but they will mature as they all do (or most of them do). Immature products don’t invalidate the problem or the opportunity or the movement; they signal an inflection point towards better products, experience and value.

Sometimes I feel old ways of coding were best. Referring business requirement docs and complete the development from scratch. If we get stuck then refer stack overflow for finding solution. It was time consuming, but logical building in our mind was consistent.

Great video Tanay. Agree on most of the points you made. As an engineer who has been with companies like Amazon, MSFT: I completely agree that the agents (at least now) are far from replacing an experienced programmer. They are great at doing VERY scoped tasks or take care of repetitive stuff. But they quickly hallucinate the moment context/complexity increases.

Until one has invested in learning programming, it quickly becomes impossible to understand the issues in the project and fix them.
